title: 105_hr4182
content: SECTION 1. FINDINGS AND PURPOSE. The Congress finds that the Brown v. Board of Education decision was significant, the Little Rock Nine integration was a catalyst for other schools, Central High School is historically important and architecturally recognized. The Act aims to preserve and interpret the significance of Little Rock Central High School in the civil rights movement and desegregation of public schools in the South. Establishment of Central High School National Historic Site. The Little Rock Central High School national historic site is established as a unit of the National Park System in Arkansas. The Secretary of the Interior will administer the site in accordance with relevant laws. Cooperative agreements can be made with public and private agencies. The Secretary will coordinate with various agencies and institutions to further the purposes of the Act, including the Little Rock School District and Central High Museum. A general management plan will be prepared within 2 years, and the Secretary will consult with the school district to ensure educational use is not disrupted. The Secretary is authorized to acquire property within the site's boundaries. The Secretary is authorized to acquire lands within the historic site boundaries through donation or exchange, with consent required from the owner. Lands owned by the State of Arkansas or its subdivisions can only be acquired by donation or exchange. SEC. 3. DESEGREGATION IN PUBLIC EDUCATION THEME STUDY. The Secretary is required to conduct a national historic landmark theme study on the history of desegregation in public education, identifying key sites and preparing a list of potential new national historic landmarks. The study will also explore opportunities for education and research by establishing linkages between sites and existing units of the National Park System. The Secretary will conduct a national historic landmark theme study on desegregation in public education, recommending cooperative arrangements with various entities to preserve key sites. The study will be part of the general management plan for the Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Sums may be appropriated as necessary for this Act.
